name: Introduction to Statistics for the Social Sciences
description: This course covers the basic concepts of statistics and the statistical methods most commonly used in the social sciences. The first half introduces descriptive statistics and the inferential statistical methods. The second half introduces bivariate and multivariate methods, emphasizing contingency table analysis and Chi-square test, regression, and analysis of variance.
exclusions: ANTC35H3, MGEB11H3/(ECMB11H3), (POLB11H3), PSYB07H3, (SOCB06H3), STAB22H3, STAB52H3, STAB57H3, STA220H, STA250H
